summary: This document is an electronic communication from the FBI requesting assistance from the Document Conversion Laboratory for scanning and automation of telephone records related to an obstruction of justice case against Alfredo Rodriguez, who was the former house manager for Jeffrey Epstein. The document outlines the procedures for handling and processing the records, emphasizing the importance of the information contained within them, particularly regarding potential underage victims.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.context: Rodriguez is the subject of an obstruction of justice case and was the former house manager and butler to Jeffrey Epstein. He possessed an address book with names and numbers of potential underage victims.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Epstein is the central figure in the child prostitution case, and his name is mentioned in relation to the address book that contained information about potential victims.

connections.description: Rodriguez worked as the house manager and butler for Epstein, indicating a direct employment relationship.

events.title: Obstruction of Justice Case Opened
events.description: The Miami Division opened an obstruction of justice case against Alfredo Rodriguez.

keyFacts: Alfredo Rodriguez attempted to sell an address book containing names and numbers of potential underage victims instead of turning it over to law enforcement.
The address book is believed to contain information related to Jeffrey Epstein and his associates.
The document outlines procedures for scanning and processing telephone records related to the investigation.
